Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
August Gold Papers TAM 295
6 Linear Feet (6 boxes)
1930-1960 1 2 3 4 5 5A 6
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Lillian Gold in 2002. The accession number associated with this gift is 2002.034.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical/Biographical Note
August Gold was a member of the Socialist Party in New York. Gold was active in various local chapters of the Party, the cooperative movement, academic freedom, andother radical movements, mostly in the United States, from the 1930s through the 1960s.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; August Gold Papers; TAM 295; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
This collection includes manuscript material, posters, photographs, a banner and buttons.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Lillian Gold, the donor of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2002 by Lilian Gold. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu.
